div2.head: The <abbr> element

def.p: This attribute locates an element that defines the full expansion of an abbreviation.

div2.head: The <accessibility> element
div2.p: The accessibility module for IDEAL document

div2.head: The <behaviour> element
div2.p: The behaviour module for IDEAL document

div2.head: The <body> element
div2.p: Contains the document's content.

div2.head: The <caption> element
div2.p: When present, the caption element's text should describe the nature of the table for the benefit of the reader.

label.code: ( PCDATA | ( ( abbr | cite | code | dfn | em | kbd | l | q | samp | span | strong | sub | sup | var ) | XForms UI Inline )* ) *

div2.head: The <cite> element
div2.p: The cite element contains a citation or a reference to other source

def.p: The value of this attribute is a URI that designates a source document or message. This attribute is intended to give further information about the element's contents (e.g., the source from which a quotation was borrowed, or the reason text was inserted or deleted).

div2.head: The <code> element
div2.p: The code element contains a fragment of computer code.

div2.head: The <col> element
div2.p: The col element allows authors to specify selection conditions or style information for a whole column in a table.

def.p: This attribute must be an integer > 0; the default value is 1. This specifies the number of columns in a colgroup, or specifies the number of columns "spanned" by the col element.

div2.head: The <currencyFormatter> element
div2.p: This formatter can be used to format a number into a currency string.

def.p: Represents a specific geographical, political or cultural region.
Defines the exact sequence of characters that are acceptable.

div2.head: The <data> element
div2.p: Represents data stored in the application context.

def.p: Indicates the expression to evaluate.
This attribute defines the name of a run-time parameter, assumed to be known by the object handler. Whether the property name is case-sensitive depends on the specific object handler implementation.

div2.head: The <dateTimeFormatter> element
div2.p: This formatter can be used to format a date or time into other according to specified format. The dateTimeFormatter also accepts dates in ISO 8601 Date and Time Formats. See http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/#isoformats

def.p: Represents a specific geographical, political or cultural region.
Defines the exact sequence of characters that are acceptable.

Represents a time zone offset. To specify a time zone, you can either enter a dateTime in UTC time by adding a "Z" behind the time - like this: '2002-05-30T09:30:10Z' or you can specify an offset from the UTC time by adding a positive or negative time behind the time - like this: '2002-05-30T09:30:10-06:00' or '2002-05-30T09:30:10+06:00'.

div2.head: The <dateTimeValidator> element
div2.p: The dateTimeValidator is used to test that a date or time conforms to a set of validation constraints. The attributes must be defined in ISO 8601 Date and Time Formats. See http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/#isoformats

def.p: Defines a list of acceptable values.
Represents a specific geographical, political or cultural region.
Specifies the upper bounds for values (the value must be less than this value).
Specifies the upper bounds for values (the value must be less than or equal to this value).
Specifies the lower bounds for values (the value must be greater than this value).
Specifies the lower bounds for values (the value must be greater than or equal to this value).
Defines the exact sequence of characters that are acceptable.
Specifies how white space is handled.

div2.head: The <dd> element
div2.p: Definition lists. These vary only slightly from other types of lists in that list items consist of two parts: a term and a description. The term is given by the dt element. The description is given with a dd element. The term and its definition can be grouped within a di element to help clarify the relationship between a term and its definition(s).

label.code: ( PCDATA | ( ( abbr | cite | code | dfn | em | kbd | l | q | samp | span | strong | sub | sup | var ) | XForms UI Inline )* ) *

div2.head: The <definitions> element
div2.p: The definitions module for IDEAL document

label.code: ( validator | stringValidator | dateTimeValidator | numberValidator | formatter | stringFormatter | numberFormatter | currencyFormatter | dateTimeFormatter | sel:variable | xforms:model )*

div2.head: The <dfn> element
div2.p: The dfn element contains the defining instance of the enclosed term.

div2.head: The <di> element
div2.p: Definition lists. These vary only slightly from other types of lists in that list items consist of two parts: a term and a description. The term is given by the dt element. The description is given with a dd element. The term and its definition can be grouped within a di element to help clarify the relationship between a term and its definition(s).

div2.head: The <div> element
div2.p: The div element, in conjunction with the id, class and role attributes, offers a generic mechanism for adding extra structure to documents. This element defines no presentational idioms on the content. Thus, authors may use this element in conjunction with style sheets, the xml:lang attribute, etc.

label.code: ( h? , ( object | span | p | table | ( nl | menu ) | ( ol | ul | dl ) | XForms Controls | XForms Controls Extension | ( xforms:repeat | xforms:group ) )* )

def.p: Decorator should be shown nearer the element.

div2.head: The <dl> element
div2.p: Definition lists. These vary only slightly from other types of lists in that list items consist of two parts: a term and a description. The term is given by the dt element. The description is given with a dd element. The term and its definition can be grouped within a di element to help clarify the relationship between a term and its definition(s).

def.p: This attribute specifies an IDREF of an element in the current document that will receive focus when the user requests that the user agent navigate to the next element that can receive focus.
This attribute specifies an IDREF of an element in the current document that will receive focus when the user requests that user agent navigate to the previous element that can receive focus.

div2.head: The <dt> element
div2.p: Definition lists. These vary only slightly from other types of lists in that list items consist of two parts: a term and a description. The term is given by the dt element. The description is given with a dd element. The term and its definition can be grouped within a di element to help clarify the relationship between a term and its definition(s).

label.code: ( PCDATA | ( ( abbr | cite | code | dfn | em | kbd | l | q | samp | span | strong | sub | sup | var ) | XForms UI Inline )* ) *

div2.head: The <em> element
div2.p: The em element indicates emphasis for its contents.

div2.head: The <ev:listener> element
div2.p: View definition of this element is on listener

div2.head: The <footer> element
div2.p: The foot body element

div2.head: The <format> element
div2.p: Action allows to format data.

def.p: Attribute specifies the id of the formatter element.

div2.head: The <formatter> element
div2.p: The formatter element allows developers to create custom formatters for formatting the data.

def.p: Specifies the URI reference of a resource that defines the handler.
Represents a specific geographical, political or cultural region.

div2.head: The <h> element
div2.p: A heading element briefly describes the topic of the section it introduces. Heading information may be used by user agents, for example, to construct a table of contents for a document automatically. Structured headings use the single h element, in combination with the section element to indicate the structure of the document, and the nesting of the sections indicates the importance of the heading. The heading for the section is the one that is a child of the section element.

label.code: ( PCDATA | ( ( abbr | cite | code | dfn | em | kbd | l | q | samp | span | strong | sub | sup | var ) | XForms UI Inline )* ) *

div2.head: The <header> element
div2.p: The head body element

div2.head: The <ideal> element
div2.p: The root element for IDEAL document

div2.head: The <include> element
div2.p: The include element specifies the inlusion of framgments into markup.

def.p: This attribute specifies the metadata associated with an element. If not specified, then the metadata for an element is its content.

div2.head: The <inputDate> element
div2.p: Date input control.

def.p: Attribute specifies the id of the formatter element.
Attribute specifies the id of the validator element.

div2.head: The <inputTime> element
div2.p: Date input control.

def.p: Attribute specifies the id of the formatter element.
Attribute specifies the id of the validator element.

div2.head: The <invoke> element
div2.p: Action allows the user to invoke code.

def.p: See http://www.w3.org/TR/2007/REC-xforms-20071029/#structure-model

div2.head: The <kbd> element
div2.p: The em element indicates emphasis for its contents.

div2.head: The <l> element
div2.p: The l element represents a semantic line of text (e.g., a line of verse or a line of computer code).

div2.head: The <label> element
div2.p: Label element is used to display information

label.code: ( PCDATA | ( ( abbr | cite | code | dfn | em | kbd | l | q | samp | span | strong | sub | sup | var ) | XForms UI Inline )* ) *

div2.head: The <li> element
div2.p: The li element defines a list item within an ordered, unordered, or navigation list.

label.code: ( PCDATA | ( ( abbr | cite | code | dfn | em | kbd | l | q | samp | span | strong | sub | sup | var ) | XForms UI Inline )* ) *

def.p: Decorator should be shown nearer the element.

div2.head: The <link> element
div2.p: An element that can be used to define links to external resources. These resources are often used to augment the Language Processor's ability to process the associated document.

def.p: This attribute describes the relationship between the resource specified by the about attribute (or its default value) and the resource referred to by the href attribute.

This attribute is the complement of the rel attribute and describes the reverse relationship between the resource specified by the about attribute (or its default value) and the resource referred to by the href attribute.

div2.head: The <menu> element
div2.p: The menu element represents a navigation list.

def.p: This attribute specifies an IDREF of an element in the current document that will receive focus when the user requests that the user agent navigate to the next element that can receive focus.
This attribute specifies an IDREF of an element in the current document that will receive focus when the user requests that user agent navigate to the previous element that can receive focus.

div2.head: The <meta> element
div2.p: The meta element can be used to identify properties of a document (e.g., author, expiration date, a list of key words, etc.) and assign values to those properties.

def.p: This attribute specifies which resource has a specified property.
This attribute specifies the metadata associated with an element. If not specified, then the metadata for an element is its content.
This attribute defines the datatype of the content metadata of the element. If the attribute is not specified, then the default value is string as defined by [XMLSCHEMA].
This attribute indicates which property is being defined by the element. If it is not specified, the property is reference.

div2.head: The <metadata> element
div2.p: Metainformation for IDEAL document

div2.head: The <nl> element
div2.p: Navigation lists are intended to be used to define collections of selectable items for presentation in a "navigation" menu. Note that a navigation list always starts with a label element that defines the label for the list

def.p: This attribute specifies an IDREF of an element in the current document that will receive focus when the user requests that the user agent navigate to the next element that can receive focus.
This attribute specifies an IDREF of an element in the current document that will receive focus when the user requests that user agent navigate to the previous element that can receive focus.

div2.head: The <numberFormatter> element
div2.p: This formatter can be used to format a number into other number according to the specified format.

def.p: Represents a specific geographical, political or cultural region.
Defines the exact sequence of characters that are acceptable.

div2.head: The <numberValidator> element
div2.p: The numberValidator is used to test that a number value conforms to a set of validation constraints.

def.p: Defines a list of acceptable values.
Specifies the maximum number of decimal places allowed. Must be equal to or greater than zero.
Represents a specific geographical, political or cultural region.
Specifies the upper bounds for values (the value must be less than this value).
Specifies the upper bounds for values (the value must be less than or equal to this value).
Specifies the lower bounds for values (the value must be greater than this value).
Specifies the lower bounds for values (the value must be greater than or equal to this value).
Defines the exact sequence of characters that are acceptable.
Specifies the exact number of digits allowed. Must be greater than zero.
Attribute specifies the element type.
Specifies how white space is handled.

div2.head: The <object> element
div2.p:
Object indicates a non-text item for inclusion in the document; this includes images and other media, as well as executable content which require plugins or external applications to process.
Note this is the way images are referenced in this language, rather than through the legacy img/@src

def.p: When present, this boolean attribute makes the current element a declaration only - one that is to be executed only after the document has completed loading and has been called through a user event.
This attribute specifies an IDREF of an element in the current document that will receive focus when the user requests that the user agent navigate to the next element that can receive focus.
This attribute specifies an IDREF of an element in the current document that will receive focus when the user requests that user agent navigate to the previous element that can receive focus.

div2.head: The <ol> element
div2.p: At least one is mandatory within a list (<li>), they are mutually exclusive within the same list. <ol> represents an item in an ordered list, <ul> represents an item in an unordered list.

def.p: This attribute specifies an IDREF of an element in the current document that will receive focus when the user requests that the user agent navigate to the next element that can receive focus.
This attribute specifies an IDREF of an element in the current document that will receive focus when the user requests that user agent navigate to the previous element that can receive focus.

div2.head:
The

element
div2.p: The p element represents a paragraph. In comparison with earlier versions of HTML, where a paragraph could only contain inline text, paragraphs represent the conceptual idea of a paragraph, and so may contain lists, blockquotes, pre's and tables as well as inline text. Note however that they may not contain directly nested p elements.

label.code: ( PCDATA | ( ( abbr | cite | code | dfn | em | kbd | l | q | samp | span | strong | sub | sup | var ) | ( ol | ul | dl ) | XForms UI Inline | table )* ) *

def.p: Decorator should be shown nearer the element.

div2.head: The <param> element
div2.p: Param elements specify a set of values that may be required to process the object data by an object handler at run-time

def.p: This attribute defines the name of a run-time parameter, assumed to be known by the object handler. Whether the property name is case-sensitive depends on the specific object handler implementation.
This attribute specifies the value of a run-time parameter specified by name. Property values have no meaning to XHTML; their meaning is determined by the object in question.

div2.head: The <phoneBookAdd> element
div2.p: Action allows the user to add phone numbers directly to device's phone book from the browser.

def.p: The contact attribute indicates the name that will be used for this contact in the phone book.

div2.head: The <q> element
div2.p: This element designates an inline text fragment of quoted text.

def.p: The value of this attribute is a URI that designates a source document or message. This attribute is intended to give further information about the element's contents (e.g., the source from which a quotation was borrowed, or the reason text was inserted or deleted).

div2.head: The <rssPanel> element
div2.p: The rsspanel element includes a RSS feed reader.

def.p: Ability to have their source RSS feeds cached.
This attribute specifies the location of an external source for the contents of the element.

div2.head: The <samp> element
div2.p: The samp element designates sample output from programs, scripts, etc.

div2.head: The <script> element
div2.p: An element that it is used to contain information pertaining to event handler implementations, usually defined in a scripting language.

div2.head: The <section> element
div2.p: The section element defines document's or application's section. Particularly, in conjunction with the h element, offers a mechanism for structuring documents into sections. This element defines content to be block-level but imposes no other presentational idioms on the content, which may otherwise be controlled from a style sheet.

label.code: ( h? , ( section | div | p | separator | include )* )

div2.head: The <sel:variable> element
div2.p: View definition of this element is on variable

div2.head: The <selgroup> element
div2.p: This form control allows the user to make chained selections from a set of selects with several choices.

def.p: See http://www.w3.org/TR/2007/REC-xforms-20071029/#structure-attrs-single-node

div2.head: The <separator> element
div2.p: The separator element separates parts of the document from each other.

div2.head: The <smsSend> element
div2.p: Action allows the user to send sms by mobile operators directly from the browser.

div2.head: The <span> element
div2.p: The span element, in conjunction with the id, class and role attributes, offers a generic mechanism for adding structure to documents. This element imposes no presentational idioms on the content. Thus, authors may use this element in conjunction with style sheets, the xml:lang attribute, etc.

def.p: Decorator should be shown nearer the element.

div2.head: The <stringFormatter> element
div2.p: The formatter can be used to format a string into other according to specified format.

def.p: Defines the exact sequence of characters that are acceptable.

div2.head: The <stringValidator> element
div2.p: The stringValidator is used to test that a string conforms to a set of validation constraints.

def.p: Defines a list of acceptable values.
Specifies the exact number of characters or list items allowed. Must be equal to or greater than zero.
Specifies the maximum number of characters or list items allowed. Must be equal to or greater than zero.
Specifies the minimum number of characters or list items allowed. Must be equal to or greater than zero.
Defines the exact sequence of characters that are acceptable.
Specifies how white space is handled.

div2.head: The <strong> element
div2.p: The strong element indicates higher importance for its contents than that of the surrounding content.

div2.head: The <sub> element
div2.p: The sub element indicates that its contents should regarded as a subscript.

div2.head: The <summary> element
div2.p: This element provides a summary of the table's purpose and structure.

label.code: ( PCDATA | ( ( abbr | cite | code | dfn | em | kbd | l | q | samp | span | strong | sub | sup | var ) | XForms UI Inline )* ) *

div2.head: The <sup> element
div2.p: The sup element indicates that its contents should be regarded as a super-script.

div2.head: The <table> element
div2.p: The table element contains all other elements that specify the caption, column groups, columns, rows, and content for a table

label.code: ( ( caption | label )? , summary? , col* , ( thead? , tbody , tfoot? ) )

def.p: This attribute specifies an IDREF of an element in the current document that will receive focus when the user requests that the user agent navigate to the next element that can receive focus.
This attribute specifies an IDREF of an element in the current document that will receive focus when the user requests that user agent navigate to the previous element that can receive focus.

div2.head: The <tbody> element
div2.p: Table rows may be grouped into a table head, a table foot, and one table body sections, using the thead, tfoot and tbody elements, respectively. This division enables Language Processor to support pagination of the table body independently of the table head and foot.

div2.head: The <td> element
div2.p: At least one is mandatory within a table row (tr), they are mutually exclusive within the same row. <th> represents a column heading, <td> represents the value of that column data for a given row.

label.code: ( PCDATA | ( ( abbr | cite | code | dfn | em | kbd | l | q | samp | span | strong | sub | sup | var ) | XForms UI Inline )* ) *

def.p: This attribute should be used to provide an abbreviated form of the cell's content, and may be rendered by user agents when appropriate in place of the cell's content. Abbreviated names should be short since user agents may render them repeatedly. For instance, speech synthesizers may render the abbreviated headers relating to a particular cell before rendering that cell's content.

This attribute specifies the number of columns spanned by the current cell. The default value of this attribute is one ("1"). The value zero ("0") means that the cell spans all columns from the current column to the last column of the column group ( colgroup) in which the cell is defined.

This attribute specifies the list of header cells that provide header information for the current data cell. The value of this attribute is a space-separated list of cell names; those cells must be named by setting their id attribute. Authors generally use the headers attribute to help non-visual user agents render header information about data cells (e.g., header information is spoken prior to the cell data), but the attribute may also be used in conjunction with style sheets. See also the scope attribute.

This attribute specifies the list of header cells that provide header information for the current data cell. The value of this attribute is a space-separated list of cell names; those cells must be named by setting their id attribute. Authors generally use the headers attribute to help non-visual user agents render header information about data cells (e.g., header information is spoken prior to the cell data), but the attribute may also be used in conjunction with style sheets. See also the scope attribute.

gitem.label: scope = NMTOKEN ( row | col | rowgroup | colgroup )

def.p: This attribute specifies the set of data cells for which the current header cell provides header information

div2.head: The <telephoneCall> element
div2.p: Action allows the user to make phone calls directly from device's browser.

def.p: The cti attribute (Computer Telephony Integration) allows interactions between the phone and a computer, including pauses and user actions number.

div2.head: The <teloutput> element
div2.p: The teloutput control allows the user to make several actions like phone calls, sms,..

def.p: Decorator should be shown nearer the element.
See http://www.w3.org/TR/2007/REC-xforms-20071029/#structure-attrs-single-node

div2.head: The <tfoot> element
div2.p: Table rows may be grouped into a table head, a table foot, and one table body sections, using the thead, tfoot and tbody elements, respectively. This division enables Language Processor to support pagination of the table body independently of the table head and foot.

div2.head: The <th> element
div2.p: At least one is mandatory within a table row (tr), they are mutually exclusive within the same row. <th> represents a column heading, <td> represents the value of that column data for a given row.

label.code: ( PCDATA | ( ( abbr | cite | code | dfn | em | kbd | l | q | samp | span | strong | sub | sup | var ) | XForms UI Inline )* ) *

def.p: This attribute should be used to provide an abbreviated form of the cell's content, and may be rendered by user agents when appropriate in place of the cell's content. Abbreviated names should be short since user agents may render them repeatedly. For instance, speech synthesizers may render the abbreviated headers relating to a particular cell before rendering that cell's content.

This attribute specifies the number of columns spanned by the current cell. The default value of this attribute is one ("1"). The value zero ("0") means that the cell spans all columns from the current column to the last column of the column group ( colgroup) in which the cell is defined.

This attribute specifies the list of header cells that provide header information for the current data cell. The value of this attribute is a space-separated list of cell names; those cells must be named by setting their id attribute. Authors generally use the headers attribute to help non-visual user agents render header information about data cells (e.g., header information is spoken prior to the cell data), but the attribute may also be used in conjunction with style sheets. See also the scope attribute.

This attribute specifies the list of header cells that provide header information for the current data cell. The value of this attribute is a space-separated list of cell names; those cells must be named by setting their id attribute. Authors generally use the headers attribute to help non-visual user agents render header information about data cells (e.g., header information is spoken prior to the cell data), but the attribute may also be used in conjunction with style sheets. See also the scope attribute.

gitem.label: scope = NMTOKEN ( row | col | rowgroup | colgroup )

def.p: This attribute specifies the set of data cells for which the current header cell provides header information

div2.head: The <thead> element
div2.p: Table rows may be grouped into a table head, a table foot, and one table body sections, using the thead, tfoot and tbody elements, respectively. This division enables Language Processor to support pagination of the table body independently of the table head and foot.

div2.head: The <tr> element
div2.p: At least one is mandatory within a table. The tr elements acts as a container for a row of table cells (either th or td, see below).

div2.head: The <ui> element
div2.p: The user interface (ui) module for IDEAL document

div2.head: The <ul> element
div2.p: At least one is mandatory within a list (<li>), they are mutually exclusive within the same list. <ol> represents an item in an ordered list, <ul> represents an item in an unordered list.

def.p: This attribute specifies an IDREF of an element in the current document that will receive focus when the user requests that the user agent navigate to the next element that can receive focus.
This attribute specifies an IDREF of an element in the current document that will receive focus when the user requests that user agent navigate to the previous element that can receive focus.

div2.head: The <validate> element
div2.p: Action allows to validate data.

def.p: Attribute specifies the id of the validator element.

div2.head: The <validator> element
div2.p: The validator element defines a custom validation.

def.p: Specifies the URI reference of a resource that defines the handler.
Attribute specifies the element type.

div2.p: The var element indicates an instance of a variable or program argument.
